inlineContent.text: The type of service to advertise. This should be a
short
text string that describes the app’s networking protocol, in the same format as a Bonjour service type (without the transport protocol) and meeting the restrictions of
(section 5.1) governing Service Name Syntax. In particular, the string:
Must be 1–15 characters long
Can contain only ASCII lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens
Must contain at least one ASCII letter
Must not begin or end with a hyphen
Must not contain hyphens adjacent to other hyphens.
This name should be easily distinguished from unrelated services. For example, a text chat app made by ABC company could use the service type
For more details, read
A dictionary of key-value pairs that are made available to browsers. Each key and value must be an
object.
This data is advertised using a Bonjour TXT record, encoded according to
(section 6). As a result:
The key-value pair must be no longer than 255 bytes (total) when encoded in UTF-8 format with an equals sign (
) between the key and the value.
Keys cannot contain an equals sign.

For optimal performance, the total size of the keys and values in this dictionary should be no more than about 400 bytes so that the entire advertisement can fit within a single Bluetooth data packet. For details on the maximum allowable length, read

If the data you need to provide is too large to fit within these constraints, create a custom discovery class using Bonjour for discovery and your choice of networking protocols for exchanging the information.
The session into which new peers should be added after they accept the invitation.
An initialized instance, or
if an error occurred.
This method throws an exception if a valid
object is not provided, or if
is not a legal Bonjour service type.

abstract.text: Support peer-to-peer connectivity and the discovery of nearby devices.

is a convenience class that handles advertising, presents incoming invitations to the user, and handles users’ responses. Use this class to provide a user interface for handling invitations when your app does not require programmatic control over the invitation process.
The delegate object that handles advertising-assistant-related events.
dictionary that was passed when this object was initialized.
The service type that your app is advertising.
The session into which new peers are added after accepting an invitation.
object enables and manages communication among all peers in a Multipeer Connectivity session.
A Unicode string value that is a collection of characters.
